questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: They're discussing something serious.
They're putting on their hats.
They're conversing with one another.
They're turning to face in the opposite direction.
questions.script:
（A）They're discussing something serious.
（B）They're putting on their hats.
（C）They're conversing with one another.
（D）They're turning to face in the opposite direction.
（A）他们正在讨论某个严肃的问题。
（B）他们正在戴帽子。
（C）他们正在相互交谈。
（D）他们把脸转向相反的方向。
·They're involved in a conversa-tion.
他们正在讨论中。
·One man is jotting something down on a note.
537

一位男士正在笔记本上草草记录着一些东西。
·They are looking at each other.
他们在互相看着对方。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: She's putting down the receiver.
She's gazing at the monitor.
She's handing over her paper.
She's taking the computer off the table.
questions.script:
（A）She's putting down the receiver.
（B）She's gazing at the monitor.
（C）She's handing over her paper.
（D）She's taking the computer off the table.
（A）她正在放下听筒。
（B）她正盯着显示器。
（C）她正在交付文件。
（D）她正在将电脑从桌上搬走。
·She's working in the office.
她正在办公室工作。
·The woman is concentrating on her work.
这位女士正在专心工作。
·There are papers sorted on the desk.
桌子上有分好类的文件。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The paper is being put away.
The paper is being cut in half.
Someone is stapling the papers together.
Someone is looking over the paper.
questions.script:
（A）The paper is being put away.
（B）The paper is being cut in half.
（C）Someone is stapling the papers together.
（D）Someone is looking over the paper.
（A）文件正在被收起。
（B）这张纸正被一裁为二。
（C）有人正在把文件装订到一起。
（D）有人正在浏览文件。
·A stapler is being used.
一个订书机正在被使用。
·Some papers are being stapled together.
一些文件正在被装订在一起。
·The stapler is in use at the moment.
订书机现在正在使用中。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: A lamp has been positioned on either side of the sofa. 538
The television is being turned on.
The sofa is occupied at the moment.
The carpet is being laid on the floor.
questions.script:
（A）A lamp has been positioned on either side of the sofa.
538

（B）The television is being turned on.
（C）The sofa is occupied at the moment.
（D）The carpet is being laid on the floor.
（A）沙发的两侧都安装了一盏灯。
（B）电视正在被打开。
（C）沙发现在有人坐。
（D）地毯正被铺到地板上。
·There is a lamp on each side of the sofa.
沙发的两侧各有一盏灯。
·The lamps are brightly lit.
这些灯都被点亮了。
·The sofas have been positioned around the room.
这些沙发已被放置在房间各处。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: They're sitting on a park bench.
They're crowding into an outdoor café.
They're all pointing toward the man.
They're seated in a small group.
questions.script:
（A）They're sitting on a park bench.
（B）They're crowding into an outdoor café.
（C）They're all pointing toward the man.
（D）They're seated in a small group.
（A）他们正坐在公园的长椅上。
（B）他们正涌向一个露天咖啡馆。
（C）他们都在指着那位男士。
（D）他们正坐在一起。
·They are sitting around a table outdoors.
他们正围坐在屋外的一张桌子旁。
·The people are seated at a table.
人们坐在一张桌子旁边。
·The table is occupied at the moment.
这张桌子现在有人在用。

questions.question: Listen to the audio and choose the best description.
options: The bakery is full of customers today.
Some baked goods are stacked on the stand.
The man is putting bread on the stand.
The bread has just been taken out of the oven.
questions.script:
（A）The bakery is full of customers today.
（B）Some baked goods are stacked on the stand.
（C）The man is putting bread on the stand.
（D）The bread has just been taken out of the oven.
（A）面包店今天挤满了顾客。
539

（B）一些烤好的食品正码放在柜台上。
（C）这位男士正在往柜台上摆放面包。
（D）面包刚被从烤箱里取出来。
·Some baked goods are displayed on the stand.
一些烤好的食品陈列在柜台上。
·Different kinds of bread have been laid out on the stand. 各种各样的面包已
被摆放在了柜台上。
·An assortment of bread is on display here.
各类面包被摆在这里。
注：在Part 1中，每道试题都添加了3种可能的正确表达方式，考生可
以了解对于同样的照片可能出现的不同表达。

questions.question: Aren't you taking off early today?
options: Yes, I usually take it home with me.
The traffic is very heavy today.
No, I have some things to finish off. 你今天不早点回去吗？
questions.script:
Aren't you taking off early today?
（A）Yes, I usually take it home with me.
（B）The traffic is very heavy today.
（C）No, I have some things to finish off.
你今天不早点回去吗？
（A）是的，我通常会把它带回家。
（B）今天交通非常拥堵。
（C）不，我有点事情需要完成。
Q Are you going to leave early today?
A No, I have to work overtime tonight.
你今天打算早点儿走吗？
—不，我今晚还得加班。

questions.question: Why did Mr. Owens decide to leave?
options: He got a better offer elsewhere.
Mr. Owens will be here soon.
Okay, I will give him a call. 为什么欧文斯先生决定离开？
questions.script:
Why did Mr. Owens decide to leave?
（A）He got a better offer elsewhere.
（B）Mr. Owens will be here soon.
（C）Okay, I will give him a call.
为什么欧文斯先生决定离开？
（A）他在别处得到了更好的工作。
（B）欧文斯先生很快就会到这里来。
（C）好的，我会给他打个电话。
Q What made Mr. Owens quit the company?
540

A He found a better paying job.
是什么让欧文斯先生离开公司的？
—他找到了一份薪水更高的工作。

questions.question: When are we getting together?
options: At John's house.
After work at six.
For his birthday. 我们什么时候碰头呢？
questions.script:
When are we getting together?
（A）At John's house.
（B）After work at six.
（C）For his birthday.
我们什么时候碰头呢？
（A）在约翰家。
（B）下班以后6点钟。
（C）为了他的生日。
Q What time is the get-together?
A Six this evening.
什么时候碰头？
—今晚6点。

questions.question: The new guy we hired is going to start Monday.
options: He will be driving here.
We could start today too.
I can't wait to meet the guy. 我们新雇用的这个家伙将会在周一开始工作。
questions.script:
The new guy we hired is going to start Monday.
（A）He will be driving here.
（B）We could start today too.
（C）I can't wait to meet the guy.
我们新雇用的这个家伙将会在周一开始工作。
（A）他会开车过来。
（B）我们也能今天开始。
（C）我等不及要见那个人了。
Q The new guy will start coming in to work next Monday.
A I wonder what he's like.
这个新人将从下周一开始来工作。
—我想知道他怎么样。

questions.question: You just returned from your overseas trip, didn't you?
options: Yes, I will be leaving today.
I had some business to take care of.
No, I got back early this morning. 你刚从国外旅游回来，是吗？
questions.script:
You just returned from your overseas trip, didn't you?
（A）Yes, I will be leaving today.
（B）I had some business to take care of.
（C）No, I got back early this morning.
你刚从国外旅游回来，是吗？
541

（A）是的，我将于今天离开。
（B）我有一些生意需要料理。
（C）不，我是今天一大早回来的。
Q Did you just get back from your overseas business trip?
A No, my plane landed early this morning.
你是刚从国外出差回来？
—不是，我坐的飞机今天一大早就到了。
注：在Part 2中，为帮助考生提高听懂题目的能力，添加了和试题相同
或相似的表达方法。

questions.question: Who placed an order for the box of printing paper?
options: Later this afternoon.
Ms. Williams did.
Yes, a new printer. 是谁下了这盒打印纸的订单？
questions.script:
Who placed an order for the box of printing paper?
（A）Later this afternoon.
（B）Ms. Williams did.
（C）Yes, a new printer.
是谁下了这盒打印纸的订单？
（A）今天下午晚些时候。
（B）威廉姆斯女士下的订单。
（C）是的，一台新打印机。
Q Who called the supplier for the printing paper?
A Mr. Williams takes care of that every month.
是谁给打印纸的供货商打了电话？
—威廉姆斯先生每个月都负责此项工作。

questions.question: When did Mr. Lewis hire his assistant?
options: About a year ago.
At our home office.
Because he is going to leave. 路易斯先生什么时候雇用了他的助理呢？
questions.script:
When did Mr. Lewis hire his assistant?
（A）About a year ago.
（B）At our home office.
（C）Because he is going to leave.
路易斯先生什么时候雇用了他的助理呢？
（A）大约一年前。
（B）在我们的总公司。
（C）因为他要离开了。
Q When did Mr. Lewis's assistant start working with him?
A Some time last year.
路易斯先生的助理是什么时候开始与他一起工作的呢？
542

—去年的某个时候。

questions.question: Where will the awards ceremony take place?
options: It'll be at the Prince Hotel.
To reward the best employees.
Lots of cash prizes. 颁奖典礼将在哪里举行？
questions.script:
Where will the awards ceremony take place?
（A）It'll be at the Prince Hotel.
（B）To reward the best employees.
（C）Lots of cash prizes.
颁奖典礼将在哪里举行？
（A）典礼将在普林斯宾馆举行。
（B）是为了奖赏最优秀的雇员。
（C）许多现金奖励。
Q Where are they going to hold the awards ceremony?
A It'll take place at the Prince Hotel.
他们将在哪里举行颁奖典礼？
—典礼将在普林斯宾馆举行。

questions.question: Do you know what time the next shuttle bus leaves from the hotel?
options: The bus stop is around the corner.
There is a bus every ten minutes.
Yes, to the airport terminal. 你知道下一趟班车什么时候从宾馆出发吗？
questions.script:
Do you know what time the next shuttle bus leaves from the hotel?
（A）The bus stop is around the corner.
（B）There is a bus every ten minutes.
（C）Yes, to the airport terminal.
你知道下一趟班车什么时候从宾馆出发吗？
（A）公共汽车站在拐角处。
（B）每十分钟有一趟班车。
（C）是的，到机场候机楼。
Q Do you know when the next bus to the airport departs from this hotel?
A In ten minutes.
你知道从这个宾馆去机场的下一趟班车什么时候发车吗？
—十分钟后。

questions.question: You've already talked to Ms. Williams about the weekly report, haven't you?
options: Yes, I just finished talking to her.
No, I can't talk to her this week.
Because it's due this Friday. 你已经和威廉姆斯女士讨论过周报了，是吗？
questions.script:
You've already talked to Ms. Williams about the weekly report, haven't you?
（A）Yes, I just finished talking to her.
（B）No, I can't talk to her this week.
（C）Because it's due this Friday.
你已经和威廉姆斯女士讨论过周报了，是吗？
（A）是的，我刚刚和她谈完。
（B）不，我这周不能和她谈。
543

（C）因为本周五到期。
Q You did get a chance to discuss the weekly report with Ms. Williams, didn't
you?
A Yes, we met over lunch today.
你确实是得到了和威廉姆斯女士讨论周报的机会，不是吗？
—是的，我们今天午饭的时候已经见面了。

questions.question: What's taking her so long?
options: It's longer than that.
At three o'clock.
She's held up in traffic. 是什么让她花了这么长时间？
questions.script:
What's taking her so long?
（A）It's longer than that.
（B）At three o'clock.
（C）She's held up in traffic.
是什么让她花了这么长时间？
（A）这个比那个长。
（B）在三点钟。
（C）她被交通耽搁了。
Q Why is she so late?
A She's caught in traffic.
她为什么这么晚？
—她遇上了交通堵塞。

questions.question: When are you expecting your guest from out of town?
options: For a week.
Early tomorrow morning.
At the Hilton Hotel downtown. 你和外地的那位客人约的什么时候来？
questions.script:
When are you expecting your guest from out of town?
（A）For a week.
（B）Early tomorrow morning.
（C）At the Hilton Hotel downtown.
你和外地的那位客人约的什么时候来？
（A）有一星期了。
（B）明天一大早。
（C）在市中心的希尔顿酒店。
Q When is your out-of-town guest arriving?
A I have to pick him up at the airport tomorrow morning.
你外地的客人什么时候来？
—我明天早上要去机场接他。

questions.question: Does your store carry blue binders?
options: I'm afraid we are out of that color. 544
No, I will bring it over right now.
No, the blue is a bit too dark. 你的商店出售蓝色活页夹吗？
questions.script:
Does your store carry blue binders?
（A）I'm afraid we are out of that color.
544

（B）No, I will bring it over right now.
（C）No, the blue is a bit too dark.
你的商店出售蓝色活页夹吗？
（A）恐怕那种颜色的我们已经卖完了。
（B）不，我现在就去把它拿过来。
（C）不，蓝色有点太暗了。
Q Do you have any blue binders in stock here?
A Sorry, but we are sold out of that color.
你这里有蓝色活页夹的存货吗？
—抱歉，那种颜色的我们已经卖光了。

questions.question: How did Karen manage to get the contract?
options: I heard it's a big deal.
She is a very smooth talker.
She likes to manage people. 卡伦是如何设法拿到那个合同的呢？
questions.script:
How did Karen manage to get the contract?
（A）I heard it's a big deal.
（B）She is a very smooth talker.
（C）She likes to manage people.
卡伦是如何设法拿到那个合同的呢？
（A）我听说那是笔大买卖。
（B）她口齿很伶俐。
（C）她喜欢管理人。
Q How did Karen get the client to sign on the dotted line?
A She's a very good saleswoman.
卡伦是怎样让客户同意签字的呢？
—她是一位非常优秀的推销员。

questions.question: Mr. Park has given us an extension on the report.
options: That's a relief.
For three days.
From the reporter. 帕克先生允许我们延期完成报告。
questions.script:
Mr. Park has given us an extension on the report.
（A）That's a relief.
（B）For three days.
（C）From the reporter.
帕克先生允许我们延期完成报告。
（A）现在我放心了。
（B）有三天了。
（C）从报告者那里。
Q Mr. Park gave us a few more days to finish the report.
A I am so glad to hear that.
545

帕克先生又给了我们几天时间以便完成报告。
—我很高兴听到这个消息。

questions.question: Who's taking care of the proofreading?
options: As soon as I finish with this book.
It hasn't been assigned yet.
Yes, I've read all of his books. 谁负责校对？
questions.script:
Who's taking care of the proofreading?
（A）As soon as I finish with this book.
（B）It hasn't been assigned yet.
（C）Yes, I've read all of his books.
谁负责校对？
（A）我一完成这本书的时候。
（B）这个任务还没有分配。
（C）是的，我已经读过了他所有的书。
Q Who reads over the work again?
A We're still looking for someone who can do that.
谁再通读一下这部著作？
—我们仍在寻找能够做这项工作的人。

questions.question: Where did Ms. Kato graduate from?
options: She has a class in half an hour.
A small college in the east, I think.
She has some colleagues there. 嘉户女士是哪里毕业的？
questions.script:
Where did Ms. Kato graduate from?
（A）She has a class in half an hour.
（B）A small college in the east, I think.
（C）She has some colleagues there.
嘉户女士是哪里毕业的？
（A）她半小时后有课。
（B）我记得是东部的一个小学院。
（C）她在那里有一些同事。
Q Where did Ms. Kato go to school?
A She went to a local college in her hometown.
嘉户女士在哪里上的学？
—她在家乡一个地方院校上的学。

questions.question: Why is John smiling like that?
options: He just heard that he got promoted.
So that he can take off early today.
It's usually like that, I guess. 约翰为什么笑成那样？
questions.script:
Why is John smiling like that?
（A）He just heard that he got promoted.
（B）So that he can take off early today.
（C）It's usually like that, I guess.
约翰为什么笑成那样？
（A）他刚听说自己被提拔了。
546

（B）这样他今天可以早点儿动身。
（C）我想情况经常是那样的。

A He got a raise.
约翰为什么那么兴奋？
—他被提拔了。

questions.question: Has Robert Cunningham gotten back to you with an answer yet?
options: Yes, he was correct.
I'll get back to him.
He'll call this evening. 罗伯特·坎宁安有没有将回复反馈给你？
questions.script:
Has Robert Cunningham gotten back to you with an answer yet?
（A）Yes, he was correct.
（B）I'll get back to him.
（C）He'll call this evening.
罗伯特·坎宁安有没有将回复反馈给你？
（A）是的，他是正确的。
（B）我过会儿给他回电话。
（C）今晚他会来电话。
Q Did Robert Cunningham respond to your offer yet?
A He said he'll get back to me by the end of the day.
罗伯特·坎宁安回复你的提议了吗？
—他说他将在今晚给我回电话。

questions.question: This particular model was only released last year.
options: Yes, it has become very popular in such a short time.
We are thinking of a name for this product.
No, there are several models available. 这种特别的样式是去年刚刚上市的。
questions.script:
This particular model was only released last year.
（A）Yes, it has become very popular in such a short time.
（B）We are thinking of a name for this product.
（C）No, there are several models available.
这种特别的样式是去年刚刚上市的。
（A）是的，它在这么短的时间内就变得非常流行了。
（B）我们正在为这个产品想名称。
（C）不，几个样式都可以用。
Q This model came out on the market only a year ago.
A Yes, and it has become a household product.
这种样式一年前才在市场上出现。
—是的，而且它已经变成了家喻户晓的产品。

questions.question: Who takes care of your taxes?
options: My accountant handles them. 547
I'll pay for it with my credit card.
No, I can't afford to take a taxi. 谁在处理你的税务问题？
questions.script:
Who takes care of your taxes?
（A）My accountant handles them.
547

（B）I'll pay for it with my credit card.
（C）No, I can't afford to take a taxi.
谁在处理你的税务问题？
（A）我的会计负责此事。
（B）我将用信用卡来付款。
（C）不，我打不起出租车。
Q Who looks after your taxes?
A My personal accountant.
谁在处理你的税务问题？
—我的私人会计。

questions.question: Will that be all, sir?
options: No, I shouldn't.
Yes, you can take it.
I'd like to see the menu again, please. 就这些了吗，先生？
questions.script:
Will that be all, sir?
（A）No, I shouldn't.
（B）Yes, you can take it.
（C）I'd like to see the menu again, please.
就这些了吗，先生？
（A）不，我不应该。
（B）是的，你可以拿走它。
（C）我想再看一下菜单。
Q Is there anything else you want, sir?
A Could I read over the menu again?
您还想要别的什么吗，先生？
—可否让我再看一下菜单？

questions.question: Do you recall when we last saw a movie together?
options: Let's go and check it out this weekend.
Yes, that sounds like a great idea.
It must've been at least a couple of years ago. 你记得我们上次一起看电影是什么时候吗？
questions.script:
Do you recall when we last saw a movie together?
（A）Let's go and check it out this weekend.
（B）Yes, that sounds like a great idea.
（C）It must've been at least a couple of years ago.
你记得我们上次一起看电影是什么时候吗？
（A）让我们这周末一起去看看吧。
（B）是的，那听起来是个不错的主意。
（C）那至少是两年前的事情了。
Q When was the last time we went to a theater together?
A The last time we went together was two years ago.
548

我们上次一起去电影院是什么时候？
—我们上次一起去是两年前了。

questions.question: That is not what you are going to wear to the concert, is it?
options: No, I have to go home and get changed.
Yes, I am a little worn out.
It is scheduled to start at 7. 那不是你去音乐会要穿的衣服，对吧？
questions.script:
That is not what you are going to wear to the concert, is it?
（A）No, I have to go home and get changed.
（B）Yes, I am a little worn out.
（C）It is scheduled to start at 7.
那不是你去音乐会要穿的衣服，对吧？
（A）不是，我还得回家换衣服。
（B）是的，我有点累了。
（C）这个定在7点开始。
Q You are not actually going to wear that to the concert, are you?
A No, I'll get changed at home first.
你不会真的要穿这身去音乐会吧？
—不，我要先回家换衣服。

questions.question:

Questions 80 through 82 refer to the following report.
In a sensational development, a spokesperson for the giant steel-making
corporation IZH,（80）which until recently has been considered one of the
driving forces behind Canada's industrial growth, announced that IZH's board of
directors has suspended the Chief Executive Officer and the head of financial
services.（80）The spokesperson declined to answer questions or go into details
regarding the suspension. However, we have learned of several relevant facts.
Our senior business and finance editor has contacted a senior member of IZH's
Accounting Department. This person, who wishes to remain anonymous at
present, has provided details of an alleged large-scale accounting fraud.
（81）Federal police and tax agents have begun an investigation which may
take months, if not years, to complete.（82）
在事态发展造成轰动之际，钢铁制造巨头IZH的发言人宣布公司董事会
对其首席执行官和财务总监进行了停职处理，该公司一直被认为是推动加拿
大工业增长的主要动力之一。发言人拒绝回答关于停职的任何问题或详述其

中的细节。但是，我们了解到几项相关的事实。我们的资深商业及金融编辑
现已与IZH财务部的一位高层人士取得了联系。这位目前不愿透露身份的人
士提供了一桩被称作是大规模会计欺诈的具体细节。联邦警方和税务代理人
已经着手开始了一项调查，完成这项调查可能会耗时数月乃至数年。

Questions 83 through 85 refer to the following short talk.
Our special guest this evening is the philosopher and author of several
novels, Nathan Boyce.（83）Nathan, or, I should say, Doctor Boyce—he has a
Ph. D. in history from one of Ireland's most respected universities—is not going to
talk you about philosophy tonight. He will talk to you about the subject of his
latest historical novel,（84）which is set in Ireland in 1916. As you all know, that
was a time of dramatic historical events. Dr. Boyce has just returned from a
lengthy research trip to Ireland and Europe. I have learned that Dr. Boyce has
been able to uncover some surprising and fascinating new details about those
tragic events.（85）So would you please welcome Dr. Boyce for some insight
into the creation of his new novel?
我们今晚的特别来宾是哲学家和多部小说的作者——内森·博伊斯。内
森，或者我应该称呼为博伊斯博士，在爱尔兰最负盛名的一所大学取得了历
史学博士学位，不过今晚他不会和大家讨论哲学。他将和大家谈谈他的最新
历史小说的主题。这部小说的背景设在1916年的爱尔兰。正如大家所知，很
多戏剧性的历史事件都发生在那个时期。博伊斯博士刚刚结束了对爱尔兰及
欧洲的长期研究访问回国。我了解到博伊斯博士发现了一些关于这些悲剧事
件的惊人的、吸引人的新细节。请大家欢迎博伊斯博士来谈谈他创作新小说
时的一些深入见解。

人的 tragic 悲剧性的 insight 见解 creation 创作，创造

Questions 86 through 88 refer to the following radio broadcast.
Today your community radio station is very pleased to invite you to the
fifth CCR Veteran and Vintage Car Rally.（86）Fifty-four absolutely beautiful,
fully-restored vehicles from the beginning of the twentieth century will make their
way from the rally point, in Federation Square, down to Exhibition Palace in
Victoria Gardens. Cars will be arriving at Federation Square at 9:00 a. m. and will
leave for Victoria Gardens at eleven o'clock. If you arrive at around 9:00 a. m.,
you will have a chance not only to inspect the cars but also to meet their
owners.（87）Entry into the Exhibition Building will cost five dollars for
adults and two dollars for seniors（88）and children under twelve years old.
Don't miss this fabulous occasion!

Questions 89 through 91 refer to the following announcement.
This is Michael from Ace Tours.（89）We have to advise you that the
unexpected heavy rain last night has made it impossible to continue with our plans
for rafting today. The water level has risen beyond the safe zone.（90）But let's
look on the bright side! As you probably know, our specialist guides are always
prepared for moments like this. We propose four different activities today.
（91）For the morning session, you can choose between rock-climbing and
hiking, and in the afternoon, there will be a choice between windsurfing and jet
584

skiing.（91）This is a rare opportunity to learn from our experts, so by no means
will this be a wasted day.
我是来自埃斯旅行社的迈克尔。我们不得不通知你们：由于昨晚突如其
来的一场大雨，我们今天的漂流不能按计划进行了。水位线已经上升并超出
了安全区域。不过让我们来看看好的一面！正如你可能知道的，我们的专业
导游往往会为这种情况做准备。我们今天计划了四种不同的活动。上午这段
时间，你们可以选择攀岩或者徒步旅行，下午可以选择帆板运动或是喷气式
滑水。这是一次向专家们学习的宝贵机会，所以这一天绝不会虚度。

Questions 92 through 94 refer to the following instructions.
Hello everyone, and welcome to the tenth Summer Teachers' Training
Camp.（92）The tight schedule we have planned for the week may be exhausting,
but it will also be very rewarding. In the mornings before breakfast, we have
special group activities, such as yoga, calligraphy, journal reading, and jogging.
After breakfast, there will be lectures in teaching techniques by some of our
guest teachers.（93）Then, we will take a long break for lunch and resume at
3:00 p.m. for the last formal session, which is a short talk followed by a discussion
on various topics. Finally, there is dinner, which we will take turns preparing in
teams,（94）and this will be followed by informal club activities such as music
and chess. As you can see, our days are busy but rewarding.
大家好！欢迎大家来到第十期暑期教师训练营。我们这周的日程安排得
很满，也许大家会觉得疲惫，但也会非常有收获。在早晨吃饭前，我们有特
别小组活动，比如瑜伽、书法、期刊阅读和慢跑。早饭后，会由几位客座教
师带来教学法讲座。然后，我们将度过一段很长的午餐时光。下午3点，我
586

们会回来进行最后一次正式会议。会上将有简短的讲话，然后是关于各种话
题的讨论。最后是晚餐，我们将分组轮流进行筹备，此后会是非正式的社团
活动，比如音乐和象棋。正如你们所见，我们这几天非常忙，但也会很有收
获。

finally 最后 take turns V-ing ~轮流做某事
